original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammānuloma (1), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽3.8. Nīvaraṇagocchaka, Kusalattika
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma  nīvaraṇa gocchaka kusalattika
translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽In conformity with the Dhamma, the Triad-based version of the Paṭṭhāna Matrix🔽The section on the hindrances, the Triad on the wholesome

original: 3.8.1. Nīvaraṇaduka, Kusalattika
analyzed: nīvaraṇa duka kusala ttika
translated: … The dyad on the hindrances, the Triad on the wholesome

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Nonīvaraṇaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nonīvaraṇo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: no nīvaraṇam kusalam dhammam paṭicca no nīvaraṇaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A wholesome, non-hindrance phenomenon is a condition, as cause condition, for a wholesome, non-hindrance phenomenon. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on cause, there is one line. In the section on object, there is one line. … In the section on non-hindrance, there is one line. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the section on conascence, etc., and in the questions, there is one line in each section.)

original: Nīvaraṇaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇo akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Nīvaraṇaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nonīvaraṇo akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: nīvaraṇam akusalam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  nīvaraṇam akusalam dhammam paṭicca no nīvaraṇaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: An unwholesome, hindrance phenomenon is a condition, as cause condition, for an unwholesome, hindrance phenomenon.🔽An unwholesome, hindrance phenomenon is a condition, as cause condition, for an unwholesome, non-hindrance phenomenon.

original: Nīvaraṇaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇo akusalo ca nonīvaraṇo akusalo ca dhammā🔽uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: nīvaraṇam akusalam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇaḥ akusalo ca no nīvaraṇaḥ akusalo ca dhammā  uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: An unwholesome, hindrance phenomenon is a condition, as cause condition, for an unwholesome, hindrance phenomenon and for an unwholesome, non-hindrance phenomenon. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on cause, there are nine lines. In the section on object, there are nine lines. … In the section on non-hindrance, there are nine lines. (Abbreviated.)

original: Paccanīya
analyzed: paccanīya
translated: Reverse order

original: Nahetu
analyzed: na hetu
translated: Not a cause

original: Nīvaraṇaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇo akusalo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—vicikicchānīvaraṇaṁ uddhaccanīvaraṇaṁ paṭicca avijjānīvaraṇaṁ.🔽Nonīvaraṇaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇo akusalo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—vicikicchāsahagate uddhaccasahagate khandhe paṭicca avijjānīvaraṇaṁ.🔽Nīvaraṇañca nonīvaraṇañca akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇo akusalo dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: nīvaraṇam akusalam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā vicikicchā nīvaraṇam uddhacca nīvaraṇam paṭicca avijjā nīvaraṇa  no nīvaraṇam akusalam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā vicikicchā sahagate uddhacca sahagate khandhe paṭicca avijjā nīvaraṇa  nīvaraṇam ca no nīvaraṇam ca akusalam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati
translated: With an object that is an obstruction, an unwholesome state … arises … (as in §1) … With an object that is not an obstruction, an unwholesome state … arises … (as in §2) … With an object that is both an obstruction and not an obstruction, an unwholesome state … arises … (as in §3) … (The rest of the permutations are to be elaborated according to §4.)

original: nahetupaccayā—vicikicchānīvaraṇañca uddhaccanīvaraṇañca sampayuttake ca khandhe paṭicca🔽avijjānīvaraṇaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava …pe… nakamme tīṇi …pe… navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavārepi … sampayuttavārepi sabbattha nava.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā vicikicchā nīvaraṇañca uddhacca nīvaraṇañca sampayuttake ca khandhe paṭicca 🔽saṅkhitta 🔽na hetuyā tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na purejāte nava pe na kamme tīṇi pe na vippayutte nava saṅkhitta 🔽sahajāta vāre pi sampayutta vāre pi sabbattha nava
translated: With an object that is not a condition being a root, there are three. With an object that is not a dominant condition, there are nine. With an object that is not a prior state, there are nine. With an object that is not kamma, there are three. With an object that is not a nutriment, there are nine. With an object that is not a faculty, there are nine. With an object that is not a contact, there are nine. With an object that is not a feeling, there are nine. With an object that is not a perception, there are nine. With an object that is not a volition, there are nine. With an object that is not an intention, there are nine. With an object that is not an underling, there are nine. With an object that is not a prenascence, there are nine. With an object that is not a distance, there are nine. With an object that is not a dissociation, there are nine.

original: Nīvaraṇo akusalo dhammo nīvaraṇassa akusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: nīvaraṇaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ nīvaraṇassa akusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An obstructed unwholesome state is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an obstructed unwholesome state. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… āsevane nava, kamme āhāre indriye jhāne magge tīṇi, sampayutte nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe āsevane nava kamme āhāre indriye jhāne magge tīṇi sampayutte nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on root-cause, there are three. In the section on object, there are nine. In the section on predominance, there are nine. … In the section on repetition, there are nine. In the sections on kamma, nutriment, faculty, jhāna, and path, there are three. In the section on association, there are nine. … In the section on non-opposition, there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on non-root-cause, there are nine. In the section on non-object, there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: In the section on root-cause condition but not as object, there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on non-root-cause condition but as object, there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: (As in the case of the three wholesome kinds of consciousness, the method of exposition should be understood here in the same way as in the exposition of the triad, the couplet, and the single term in the case of the three kinds of wholesome consciousness.)

original: Nonīvaraṇaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nonīvaraṇo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: no nīvaraṇam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca no nīvaraṇaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A non-obstructed indeterminate state is conditionally originated by way of root-cause condition from a non-obstructed indeterminate state. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on root-cause, there is one. In the section on object, there is one. … In the section on non-opposition, there is one. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the section on origination, etc., too, each time the triplet is to be elaborated in the same way as the dyad.)

original: 3.8.2. Nīvaraṇiyaduka, Kusalattika
analyzed: nīvaraṇiyaduka kusalattika
translated: … with the hindrances as the first factor, the wholesome triad

original: Hetu🔽Nīvaraṇiyaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇiyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetu  nīvaraṇiyam kusalam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇiyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Root Cause🔽A wholesome, hindrance-free state is a condition, as root cause, for a wholesome, hindrance-free state.

original: Anīvaraṇiyaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anīvaraṇiyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: anīvaraṇiyam kusalam dhammam paṭicca anīvaraṇiyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta  hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve pe avigate dve
translated: A wholesome, hindrance-free state is a condition, as root cause, for a wholesome, hindrance-free state. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi …pe… pañhāvāropi vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāro pi pe pañhā vāro pi vitthāretabbā
translated: In the section on root cause there are two. In the section on object there are two. … In the section on non-hindrance there are two. (In brief.)🔽(In the section on origination, etc., too, each time the triplet is to be elaborated in the same way as the dyad.)

original: Nīvaraṇiyaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇiyo akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: nīvaraṇiyam akusalam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇiyaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: An unwholesome, hindrance-related state is a condition, as root cause, for an unwholesome, hindrance-related state. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta  sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: In the section on root cause there is one. In the section on object there is one. … In the section on non-hindrance there is one. (In brief.)🔽(In the section on origination, etc., too, each time the triplet is to be elaborated in the same way as the dyad.)

original: Nīvaraṇiyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇiyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: nīvaraṇiyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇiyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: An indeterminate, hindrance-free state is a condition, as root cause, for an indeterminate, hindrance-free state.

original: Anīvaraṇiyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anīvaraṇiyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: anīvaraṇiyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca anīvaraṇiyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an object that is not an obstruction, that is indeterminate, … (as in preceding chapter, but with the words “an obstruction” and “an obstruction” replaced by “not an obstruction” and “not an obstruction” respectively.)🔽With an object that is an obstruction, that is indeterminate, and with an object that is not an obstruction, that is indeterminate, … (as in preceding chapter, but with the words “an obstruction” and “an obstruction” replaced by “an obstruction” and “not an obstruction” respectively.)

original: Nīvaraṇiyaṁ abyākatañca anīvaraṇiyaṁ abyākatañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇiyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… āsevane ekaṁ …pe… vipāke pañca …pe… avigate pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) (Sahajātavāropi …pe… pañhāvāropi vitthāretabbā.)
analyzed: nīvaraṇiyam abyākatam ca anīvaraṇiyam abyākatam ca dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇiyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta  hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe āsevane ekam pe vipāke pañca pe avigate pañca saṅkhitta sahajāta vāropi pe pañhā vāropi vitthāretabbā
translated: … with an object that is an obstruction, that is indeterminate, … (as in preceding chapter, but with the words “an obstruction” and “an obstruction” replaced by “an obstruction” and “not an obstruction” respectively.)🔽… with an object that is an obstruction, that is indeterminate, … (as in preceding chapter, but with the words “an obstruction” and “an obstruction” replaced by “an obstruction” and “not an obstruction” respectively.)🔽… with an object that is an obstruction, that is indeterminate, … (as in preceding chapter, but with the words “an obstruction” and “an obstruction” replaced by “an obstruction” and “not an obstruction” respectively.)

original: 3.8.3. Nīvaraṇasampayuttaduka, Kusalattika🔽Hetu🔽Nīvaraṇavippayuttaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇavippayutto kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu  nīvaraṇa vippayuttam kusalam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇa vippayuttaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: … with an object that is an obstruction, that is indeterminate, … (as in preceding chapter, but with the words “an obstruction” and “an obstruction” replaced by “an obstruction” and “not an obstruction” respectively.)🔽… with an object that is an obstruction, that is indeterminate, … (as in preceding chapter, but with the words “an obstruction” and “an obstruction” replaced by “an obstruction” and “not an obstruction” respectively.)🔽… with an object that is an obstruction, that is indeterminate, … (as in preceding chapter, but with the words “an obstruction” and “an obstruction” replaced by “an obstruction” and “not an obstruction” respectively.)🔽… with an object that is an obstruction, that is indeterminate, … (as in preceding chapter, but with the words “an obstruction” and “an obstruction” replaced by “an obstruction” and “not an obstruction” respectively.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: … with an object that is an obstruction, that is indeterminate, … (as in preceding chapter, but with the words “an obstruction” and “an obstruction” replaced by “an obstruction” and “not an obstruction” respectively.)🔽… with an object that is an obstruction, that is indeterminate, … (as in preceding

original: Nīvaraṇasampayuttaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇasampayutto akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: nīvaraṇa sampayuttam akusalam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇa sampayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: A state that is associated with the hindrances and is unwholesome is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a state that is associated with the hindrances and is unwholesome. (In brief:) …🔽(In brief:) …

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the section on origination through immediate-proximity condition, etc., and in the section on the questions, there is one result in each triad.)

original: Nīvaraṇavippayuttaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇavippayutto abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: nīvaraṇa vippayuttam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇa vippayuttaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: A state that is dissociated from the hindrances and is neutral is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a state that is dissociated from the hindrances and is neutral. (In brief:) …🔽(In brief:) …

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the section on origination through immediate-proximity condition, etc., and in the section on the questions, there is one result in each triad.)

original: 3.8.4. Nīvaraṇanīvaraṇiyaduka, Kusalattika
translated: … The Triad with Hindrance and Hindrance-Free, the Wholesome

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Root-Cause

original: Nīvaraṇiyañceva no ca nīvaraṇaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇiyo ceva no ca nīvaraṇo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: nīvaraṇiyam ca iva no ca nīvaraṇam kusalam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇiyaḥ ca iva no ca nīvaraṇaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: A wholesome state that is a hindrance and is also hindrance-free is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a wholesome state that is hindrance-free but is not a hindrance. (In brief:) …

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: (In brief:) …

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the section on origination, etc., too, there are three triads and three dyads.)

original: Nīvaraṇañceva nīvaraṇiyañca akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇo ceva nīvaraṇiyo ca akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Nīvaraṇiyañceva no ca nīvaraṇaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇiyo ceva no ca nīvaraṇo akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: nīvaraṇam ca iva nīvaraṇiyam ca akusalam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇaḥ ca iva nīvaraṇiyaḥ ca akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  nīvaraṇiyam ca iva no ca nīvaraṇam akusalam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇiyaḥ ca iva no ca nīvaraṇaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With the unwholesome root, and with the unwholesome root and with the distorting of truth, there arises what is unwholesome and a distorting of truth by way of root condition … three times.🔽With the unwholesome root and with the distorting of truth, there arises what is unwholesome and a distorting of truth by way of root condition … three times.

original: Nīvaraṇañceva nīvaraṇiyaṁ akusalañca nīvaraṇiyañceva no ca nīvaraṇaṁ akusalañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇo ca nīvaraṇiyo ca akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: nīvaraṇam ca iva nīvaraṇiyam akusalam ca nīvaraṇiyam ca iva no ca nīvaraṇam akusalañca dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇaḥ ca nīvaraṇiyaḥ ca akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi saṅkhitta  hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: With the unwholesome root and with the unwholesome root and with the distorting of truth, there arises what is unwholesome and a distorting of truth by way of root condition … three times. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha nava.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha nava
translated: In the section on cause there are nine; in the section on object there are nine; … in the section on non-disappearance there are nine. (In brief.)🔽(In the section on origination, etc., too, there are nine triads and nine dyads.)

original: Nīvaraṇiyañceva no ca nīvaraṇaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇiyo ceva no ca nīvaraṇo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽3.8.5. Nīvaraṇanīvaraṇasampayuttaduka, Kusalattika🔽Hetu🔽Nīvaraṇañceva nīvaraṇasampayuttañca akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇo ceva nīvaraṇasampayutto ca akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha nava.)

original: Nīvaraṇavippayuttaṁ nīvaraṇiyaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇavippayutto nīvaraṇiyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: nīvaraṇa vippayuttam nīvaraṇiyam kusalam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇa vippayuttaḥ nīvaraṇiyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a wholesome object that is unconnected and not a root cause, and that is not a condition by way of root cause, there is a wholesome object that is unconnected and not a root cause. (Condensed.)🔽With a wholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition for the hindrances, there is a wholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition for the hindrances. (Condensed.)

original: Nīvaraṇavippayuttaṁ anīvaraṇiyaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇavippayutto anīvaraṇiyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: nīvaraṇa vippayuttam anīvaraṇiyam kusalam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇa vippayuttaḥ anīvaraṇiyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta  hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve pe avigate dve
translated: With a wholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition by way of decisive support, there is a wholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition by way of decisive support. (Condensed.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi …pe… pañhāvāropi vitthāretabbā.)🔽Nīvaraṇavippayuttaṁ nīvaraṇiyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇavippayutto nīvaraṇiyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: sahajāta vāro pi pe pañhā vāro pi vitthāretabbā  nīvaraṇa vippayuttam nīvaraṇiyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇa vippayuttaḥ nīvaraṇiyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: (The section on “with origination” should be expanded in detail.)🔽With an unwholesome object that is unconnected and not a root cause, and that is not a condition by way of root cause, there is an unwholesome object that is unconnected and not a root cause. (Condensed.)🔽With an unwholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition for the hindrances, there is an unwholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition for the hindrances. (Condensed.)🔽With an unwholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition by way of decisive support, there is an unwholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition by way of decisive support. (Condensed.)

original: Nīvaraṇavippayuttaṁ anīvaraṇiyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇavippayutto anīvaraṇiyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: nīvaraṇa vippayuttam anīvaraṇiyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇa vippayuttaḥ anīvaraṇiyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an unwholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition by way of prenascence, there is an unwholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition by way of prenascence. (Condensed.)🔽With an unwholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition by way of proximity, there is an unwholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition by way of proximity. (Condensed.)🔽With an unwholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition by way of contiguity, there is an unwholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition by way of contiguity. (Condensed.)🔽With an unwholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition by way of association, there is an unwholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition by way of association. (Condensed.)🔽With an unwholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition by way of presence, there is an unwholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition by way of presence. (Condensed.)🔽With an unwholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition by way of non-disappearance, there is an unwholesome object that is unconnected and not a condition by way of non-

original: Nīvaraṇavippayuttaṁ nīvaraṇiyaṁ abyākatañca nīvaraṇavippayuttaṁ anīvaraṇiyaṁ abyākatañca
analyzed: nīvaraṇa vippayuttam nīvaraṇiyam abyākatam ca nīvaraṇa vippayuttam anīvaraṇiyam abyākatam ca
translated: Neither-connected-nor-disconnected, subject to Clinging, and Undetermined, and neither-connected-nor-disconnected, not subject to Clinging, and Undetermined.

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca nīvaraṇavippayutto nīvaraṇiyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca nīvaraṇa vippayuttaḥ nīvaraṇiyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Dependent on a state that is not connected with the hindrances and is not a hindrance, an unwholesome state that is not connected with the hindrances and is not a hindrance arises …🔽(Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… āsevane ekaṁ, vipāke pañca …pe… avigate pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe āsevane eka vipāke pañca pe avigate pañca saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on root cause, there are five; in the section on object, there are two; … in the section on nutriment, there is one; in the section on result, there are five; … in the section on the unwholesome, there are five. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽Nīvaraṇagocchakakusalattikaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha vitthāretabba 🔽nīvaraṇa gocchaka kusala ttikam niṭṭhita
translated: (In the section on conascence, etc., and in the Question Section, all the triplets are to be expanded in the same way as the first triad.)🔽The permutation series of the connected and disconnected states that are hindrances and are associated with the hindrances, etc., is finished.
